thinking.disposable_income: Mixed-income community with 43.5% making $100k+ but also 32.6% under $50k. About 15.6% are low-income (<$25k), suggesting need to consider affordability
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution, higher sales taxes would affect both high and low-income residents, but impact would be more severe for the 32.6% lower-income households who have less discretionary spending
thinking.accessibility: 68% own 1+ vehicles, with 19.8% car-free. 21.5% use transit for commuting, indicating significant transit reliance. Good mix of transportation options needed
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize balanced policies that don't overly burden either drivers or transit users given mixed transportation needs. 2. Favor moderate tax rates (1%) over high (1.5%) to protect discretionary spending. 3. Support some driving fees to improve transit service while keeping fares affordable. 4. Consider proposals that reduce transit travel time to benefit the 21.5% transit commuters. 5. Choose options that maintain reasonable car travel times for the 49.7% who drive alone.
